sen.j: 影武者（かげむしゃ）とは、日本の戦国時代 (日本)の武将などが用いた、自分と同じ服装をさせて身代わりとさせた人物のこと。
sen.e: Kagemusha(body double) is a person employed by busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period of Japan or the like as his straw man dressed in the same clothes.
Kagemusha (body double) is a person employed by busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period of Japan or the like as his straw man dressed in the same clothes.

"Kagemusha" (the body double) is a person, during the Sengoku period (the period of warring states), employed by a busho (a Japanese military commander) as his straw man dressed in the identical clothes as his.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Kagemusha にダブルクォーテーションを追記しました。

sen.j: 君主の喪を隠したり、敵を混乱させる事等を目的に用いられた。
sen.e: It was employed for the purpose of disguising mourning for a monarch, confusing enemies, and so on.
It was employed for the purpose of disguising mourning for a monarch, confusing enemies, and so on.
Kagemusha was employed for the purposes including disguising the death of a lord, or confusing enemies.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 当時は写真が無かったため、襲撃者が主君の顔を知っているとは限らず有効な手段であった。
sen.e: Since photography was not present and assailant may have not known the face of the monarch at the time, it was an effective measure.
Since photography was not available and an assailant may not have known the face of the monarch at the time, it was an effective measure.
Since photography was not available at that time and an assailant did not always know the face of the lord, it was an effective measure.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 一般的には替え玉（ダミー）という。
sen.e: It is generally called a dummy.
It is generally called a dummy.
Kagamusha is generally referred to as a "dummy".
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。ダブルクォーテーションを全角から半角に修正しました。

sen.j: 真田信繁(幸村)は７人もの影武者を用いて、戦場で敵を混乱させたといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that Nobushige (Yukimura) SANADA confused his enemies in the battlefield using as many as seven kagemushas.
It is said that Nobushige (Yukimura) SANADA confused his enemies in the battlefield using as many as seven kagemushas.

sen.j: また現代においても、北朝鮮の金正日には影武者が存在するという説がある。
sen.e: Even in the present day, there is a view that Kim Jong-il in North Korea has his kagemusha

sen.e: Even in the present day, there is a view that Kim Jong-il of North Korea has his own kagemusha
Even in the present day, there is a view that Kim Jong-il of North Korea has his own kagemusha.

sen.j: 本人はすでに死亡しており影武者を使って生きているように見せかけていると唱える者もいる。
sen.e: Some people allege that he is already dead just disguising that he is still alive using the kagemusha.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some people allerge that he is already dead, just disguising that he is still alive by using kagemusha.
Some people allege that while he is actually already dead, they are disguising the kagemusha as Kim Jong-il.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 上記の意味が転じて、現代においても著名人がマスメディアの取材、追跡を避けるため、秘書や友人など関係者を身代わりとして、マスメディアを引き付けることを「影武者」という。
sen.e: Turning from the above meaning, it is called "kagemusha" in the present day to distract the attention of mass media from a celebrity using his related person such as a secretary or a friend as his dummy in order to avoid interviews and chases by the mass media.

Turning from the above meaning, it is called "kagemusha" in the present day to distract the attention of mass media from a celebrity using people related to him, such as a secretary or a friend as his dummy in order to avoid interviews and being chased by the mass media.

Derived from the meaning above, the term "kagemusha" is used today to refer to a celebrities' tactic to distract the attention of mass-media by using a secretary or a friend as their dummy in order to avoid interviews or being chased by paparazzi.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。ダブルクォーテーションおよびアポストロフィを全角から半角に修正しました。
